title: Former Kurdish-led fighters and Damascus test a fragile 'reconciliation' in northeastern Syria
subhead: After retaking the provinces of Deir ez-Zor, Raqqa and Hassakeh, Syria's transitional authorities opened reconciliation centers for former fighters from the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces to surrender their weapons.

title: Trump ramps up pressure on Iran by deploying aircraft carrier and threatening strikes
Novelist Boualem Sansal elected to Académie Française after prison ordeal
PFAS: Pollution in the EU could cost up to €1.7 trillion
subhead: A study commissioned by the European Commission confirms the significant financial burden of forever chemicals for European societies, with costs varying depending on political decisions.

title: Starmer's China visit symbolizes Western leaders' shift amid unease with Trump
subhead: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer arrived in China on Thursday, two weeks after Canada's Mark Carney, and ahead of a likely visit by the German chancellor. These visits are a boon for the Chinese government, which presents itself as a reliable partner, the opposite of Donald Trump.

title: Ali Akbar, Paris's last newspaper hawker, honored by Macron
subhead: The French president presented Ali Akbar with one of the French government's highest honors on Wednesday evening. Akbar has sold Le Monde for decades in the Saint-Germain-des-Prés neighborhood of Paris.

title: 'The only thing left to do is leave': Cuba pushed to the brink
subhead: 'Cuba, an island adrift' (2/3). Since the wave of unrest that swept the country in 2021, more than two million Cubans have fled. Those who remain on the island scrape by with varying degrees of success, as the exorbitant price of basic goods has become a source of inequality between those with nothing and those with access to foreign currency.

'For sure': Two impromptu words by Macron go viral
subhead: During his speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos, the French president delivered a common English phrase – in a strong accent – that achieved global fame.

title: Veteran civil servant Xavier Piechaczyk to head Paris public transports
subhead: France's Parliament approved President Emmanuel Macron's nominee to head the RATP on Wednesday. The appointment now awaits formal confirmation by decree.

title: Work-related cancers remain a blind spot in France's public health system
subhead: A study conducted by doctors and occupational sociologists at the Avignon Hospital Center on over 500 lymphoma patients found there was a 'massive underestimation' of work-related cancers in France.

title: The need to speak truth about immigration
John Bolton: 'Toppling the Iranian regime is the most effective way to remove the terrorist threat the West has faced'
